newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Yield Spreads-underperform vs bloc.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Yield Spreads-underperform vs bloc.

text.p: Australian bond yield spreads blew out sharply against the dollar bloc after local futures broke technical support levels and triggered hedge fund selling, traders said.
The move saw the 10-year cash bond yield breach 8.0 percent to its highest level since October last year, and recent resistance at around 130 basis point on the 10-year margin to the U.S. tested.

Domestic bonds got off on a weak footing after the U.S. CPI for February came in marginally higher than expectations, leaving the U.S. Treasury market, fretting over a possible hike in U.S. interest rates when the Federal Open Market Committee meest on March 25.
However, the move to the U.S. was judged against levels seen in New York as Japan was closed for a holiday.
Local bonds were also outperformed by Canadian and New Zealand debt, which benefitted from rebounds in their respective currencies.
